rationales: First, we need to understand what Persephone is. Persephone is a mythical creature in Greek mythology, known as the goddess of the underworld and the heiress to the heavens. She is believed to have lived centuries before the creatures of the Underworld were born. Next, we need to understand what a landscape architect is. A landscape architect is an architect who designs and develops landscapes and spaces. They include landscape designs and infrastructure. Now, we can consider if Persephone, as a mythical creature, is a good advisor for a landscape architect. In Greek mythology, Persephone is believed to have had an impact on animals and plants, and her knowledge and experience of animals and plants has given her a clear and effective tool for this work. Her knowledge and experience with landscape design would complement and reinforce his/her expertise in designing and creating complex landscapes. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) yes, Persephone would be a good consultant to a landscape architect. Answer: A

knowledge: Mother Nature . In Greek mythology, Persephone, daughter of Demeter (goddess of the harvest), was abducted by Hades (god of the dead), and taken to the underworld as his queen. Demeter was so distraught that no crops would grow and the "entire human race [would] have perished of cruel, biting hunger if Zeus had not been concerned" (Larousse 152). Zeus forced Hades to return Persephone to her mother, but while in the underworld, Persephone had eaten pomegranate seeds, the food of the dead and thus, she must spend part of each year with Hades in the underworld. Demeter's grief for her daughter in the realm of the dead, is reflected in the barren winter months and her joy when Persephone returns is reflected in the bountiful summer months.
